definition: permanent residency permit (originally referred specifically to the US green card)
to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette

sentences.english: The green card was a passport to the American Dream.
sentences.chinese: 因爲綠卡就是一張完成美國夢的通行證。

sentences.english: Pilco's next step is getting a green card.
sentences.chinese: 皮爾克下一步計劃獲得一張綠卡。

sentences.english: Five years on, the card is an increasingly sought-after document.
sentences.chinese: 歷經5年，中國綠卡正變得越來越搶手。

sentences.english: It can also be used to apply for a Social Security Card and a state issued driver’s license.
sentences.chinese: 綠卡也能用於申請社保卡和國家頒發的駕照。

sentences.english: I worked there for two years, until I received my green card.
sentences.chinese: 我在那兒工作了兩年，直到我拿到了綠卡。

definition: identity card/also written 身份證|身份证[shen1 fen4 zheng4]
student studying abroad/(foreign) exchange student/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]
to issue (a document)/to sign and issue officially
a pass (authority to enter)/a laissez-passer or safe conduct
population (counted as number of households for census or taxation)/registered residence/residence permit/(in Hong Kong and Macau) bank account
